summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 22450 entitled "An Ordinance providing for the laying off, widening, altering and establishing of Thirtieth Avenue South, from Lane Street to Charles Street in The City of Seattle; and providing for the condemnation, appropriation, taking and damaging of land and other property necessary therefor, and providing that the payment for such improvement be made by special assessment upon property specially benefited, in the manner provided by law," approved November 23rd, 1909, and authorizing the dismissal of the action in the Superior Court of King County based upon said Ordinance, and authorizing the payment of all taxable costs.
